alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Caribou Range (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 2:31PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Caribou and eastern Bear Lake Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 230 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bear Lake, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Montpelier, Bear Lake Idaho Portion, Georgetown, Dingle, Border Summit, Geneva, Geneva Summit, Bennington, Pegram and Bern. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Bear Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
